description.para: Reimplement these member functions in derived class for better control over wxPropertyGrid behaviour.

briefdescription.para: Override in derived class to display error messages in custom manner (these message usually only result from validation failure).

simplesect.para: If you implement this, then you also need to implement DoHidePropertyError() - possibly to do nothing, if error does not need hiding (e.g. it was logged or shown in a message box).

briefdescription.para: Override in derived class to hide an error displayed by DoShowPropertyError().
Return wxStatusBar that is used by this wxPropertyGrid.

detaileddescription.para: You can reimplement this member function in derived class to override the default behaviour of using the top-level wxFrame's status bar, if any.

description.para: These member functions are usually only called when creating custom user properties.

briefdescription.para: Call when editor widget's contents is modified.

detaileddescription.para: For example, this is called when changes text in wxTextCtrl (used in wxStringProperty and wxIntProperty).

simplesect.para: This function should only be called by custom properties.

briefdescription.para: Reverse of EditorsValueWasModified().

simplesect.para: This function should only be called by custom properties.

briefdescription.para: Returns most up-to-date value of selected property.

detaileddescription.para: This will return value different from GetSelectedProperty()->GetValue() only when text editor is activate and string edited by user represents valid, uncommitted property value.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if editor's value was marked modified.
Shows an brief error message that is related to a property.
You can use this member function, for instance, to detect in wxPGProperty::OnEvent() if wxPGProperty::SetValueInEvent() was already called in wxPGEditor::OnEvent().

detaileddescription.para: It really only detects if was value was changed using wxPGProperty::SetValueInEvent(), which is usually used when a 'picker' dialog is displayed. If value was written by "normal means" in wxPGProperty::StringToValue() or IntToValue(), then this function will return false (on the other hand, wxPGProperty::OnEvent() is not even called in those cases).

briefdescription.para: Two step constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Call Create() when this constructor is called to build up the wxPropertyGrid

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxPG_DEFAULT_STYLE, const wxString &name=wxPropertyGridNameStr)
memberdef.name: wxPropertyGrid

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: The styles to be used are styles valid for the wxWindow.

simplesect.para: wxPropertyGrid Window Styles.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Adds given key combination to trigger given action.

detaileddescription.para: Here is a sample code to make Enter key press move focus to the next property.

parameterdescription.para: Which action to trigger. See wxPropertyGrid Action Identifiers.
Which keycode triggers the action.
Which key event modifiers, in addition to keycode, are needed to trigger the action.

briefdescription.para: Adds given property into selection.

detaileddescription.para: If wxPG_EX_MULTIPLE_SELECTION extra style is not used, then this has same effect as calling SelectProperty().

simplesect.para: Multiple selection is not supported for categories. This means that if you have properties selected, you cannot add category to selection, and also if you have category selected, you cannot add other properties to selection. This member function will fail silently in these cases, even returning true.

briefdescription.para: Creates label editor wxTextCtrl for given column, for property that is currently selected.

detaileddescription.para: When multiple selection is enabled, this applies to whatever property GetSelection() returns.

parameterdescription.para: Which column's label to edit. Note that you should not use value 1, which is reserved for property value column.

simplesect.para: EndLabelEdit(), MakeColumnEditable()

briefdescription.para: Changes value of a property, as if from an editor.

detaileddescription.para: Use this instead of SetPropertyValue() if you need the value to run through validation process, and also send the property change event.

simplesect.para: Returns true if value was successfully changed.

briefdescription.para: Centers the splitter.

parameterdescription.para: If true, automatic column resizing is enabled (only applicapple if window style wxPG_SPLITTER_AUTO_CENTER is used).

briefdescription.para: Deletes all properties.
Clears action triggers for given action.

parameterdescription.para: Which action to trigger. wxPropertyGrid Action Identifiers.

briefdescription.para: Forces updating the value of property from the editor control.

detaileddescription.para: Note that wxEVT_PG_CHANGING and wxEVT_PG_CHANGED are dispatched using ProcessEvent, meaning your event handlers will be called immediately.

simplesect.para: Returns true if anything was changed.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxPG_DEFAULT_STYLE, const wxString &name=wxPropertyGridNameStr)
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Two step creation.

detaileddescription.para: Whenever the control is created without any parameters, use Create to actually create it. Don't access the control's public methods before this is called

simplesect.para: wxPropertyGrid Window Styles.

briefdescription.para: Dedicates a specific keycode to wxPropertyGrid.

detaileddescription.para: This means that such key presses will not be redirected to editor controls.
Using this function allows, for example, navigation between properties using arrow keys even when the focus is in the editor control.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables (shows/hides) categories according to parameter enable.

simplesect.para: This functions deselects selected property, if any. Validation failure option wxPG_VFB_STAY_IN_PROPERTY is not respected, ie. selection is cleared even if editor had invalid value.

briefdescription.para: Destroys label editor wxTextCtrl, if any.

parameterdescription.para: Use true (default) to store edited label text in property cell data.

simplesect.para: BeginLabelEdit(), MakeColumnEditable()

briefdescription.para: Scrolls and/or expands items to ensure that the given item is visible.

simplesect.para: Returns true if something was actually done.

briefdescription.para: Reduces column sizes to minimum possible, while still retaining fully visible grid contents (labels, images).

detaileddescription.para:
Minimum size for the grid to still display everything.
Does not work well with wxPG_SPLITTER_AUTO_CENTER window style. This function only works properly if grid size prior to call was already fairly large.
Note that you can also get calculated column widths by calling GetState->GetColumnWidth() immediately after this function returns.

briefdescription.para: Returns currently active label editor, NULL if none.
Returns wxWindow that the properties are painted on, and which should be used as the parent for editor controls.
Returns current category caption background colour.
Returns current category caption font.
Returns current category caption text colour.
Returns current cell background colour.
Returns current cell text colour when disabled.
Returns current cell text colour.
Returns number of columns currently on grid.
Returns colour of empty space below properties.
Returns height of highest characters of used font.
Returns pointer to itself.

detaileddescription.para: Dummy function that enables same kind of code to use wxPropertyGrid and wxPropertyGridManager.

briefdescription.para: Returns rectangle of custom paint image.

parameterdescription.para: Return image rectangle for this property.
Which choice of property to use (each choice may have different image).

briefdescription.para: Returns size of the custom paint image in front of property.

parameterdescription.para: Return image rectangle for this property. If this argument is NULL, then preferred size is returned.
Which choice of property to use (each choice may have different image).

briefdescription.para: Returns last item which could be iterated using given flags.

parameterdescription.para: See wxPropertyGridIterator Flags.

briefdescription.para: Returns colour of lines between cells.
Returns background colour of margin.
Returns "root property".

detaileddescription.para: It does not have name, etc. and it is not visible. It is only useful for accessing its children.

briefdescription.para: Returns height of a single grid row (in pixels).
Returns currently selected property.
Returns currently selected property.
Returns current selection background colour.
Returns current selection text colour.
Returns the property sort function (default is NULL).
Returns current splitter x position.
Returns wxTextCtrl active in currently selected property, if any.

detaileddescription.para: Takes wxOwnerDrawnComboBox into account.

briefdescription.para: Returns current appearance of unspecified value cells.
Returns (visual) text representation of the unspecified property value.

parameterdescription.para: For internal use only.

briefdescription.para: Returns current vertical spacing.
Returns information about arbitrary position in the grid.

parameterdescription.para: Coordinates in the virtual grid space. You may need to use wxScrolled<T>::CalcScrolledPosition() for translating wxPropertyGrid client coordinates into something this member function can use.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if any property has been modified by the user.
Returns true if a property editor control has focus.
Returns true if updating is frozen (ie.

detaileddescription.para: Freeze() called but not yet Thaw() ).

briefdescription.para: Makes given column editable by user.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the column to make editable.
Using false here will disable column from being editable.

simplesect.para: BeginLabelEdit(), EndLabelEdit()

briefdescription.para: It is recommended that you call this function any time your code causes wxPropertyGrid's top-level parent to change.

detaileddescription.para: wxPropertyGrid's OnIdle() handler should be able to detect most changes, but it is not perfect.

parameterdescription.para: New top-level parent that is about to be set. Old top-level parent window should still exist as the current one.

simplesect.para: This function is automatically called from wxPropertyGrid:: Reparent() and wxPropertyGridManager::Reparent(). You only need to use it if you reparent wxPropertyGrid indirectly.

briefdescription.para: Refreshes any active editor control.
Redraws given property.
Resets all colours to the original system values.
Resets column sizes and splitter positions, based on proportions.

parameterdescription.para: If true, automatic column resizing is enabled (only applicapple if window style wxPG_SPLITTER_AUTO_CENTER is used).

briefdescription.para: Removes given property from selection.

detaileddescription.para: If property is not selected, an assertion failure will occur.

briefdescription.para: Selects a property.

detaileddescription.para: Editor widget is automatically created, but not focused unless focus is true.

parameterdescription.para: Property to select (name or pointer).
If true, move keyboard focus to the created editor right away.

simplesect.para: returns true if selection finished successfully. Usually only fails if current value in editor is not valid.
In wxPropertyGrid 1.4, this member function used to generate wxEVT_PG_SELECTED. In wxWidgets 2.9 and later, it no longer does that.
This clears any previous selection.

briefdescription.para: Sets category caption background colour.
Sets category caption text colour.
Sets default cell background colour - applies to property cells.

detaileddescription.para: Note that appearance of editor widgets may not be affected.

briefdescription.para: Sets cell text colour for disabled properties.
Sets default cell text colour - applies to property name and value text.

detaileddescription.para: Note that appearance of editor widgets may not be affected.

briefdescription.para: Set number of columns (2 or more).
Sets the 'current' category - Append will add non-category properties under it.
Sets colour of empty space below properties.
Sets colour of lines between cells.
Sets background colour of margin.
Set entire new selection from given list of properties.
Sets selection background colour - applies to selected property name background.
Sets selection foreground colour - applies to selected property name text.
Sets the property sorting function.

parameterdescription.para: The sorting function to be used. It should return a value greater than 0 if position of p1 is after p2. So, for instance, when comparing property names, you can use following implementation:

simplesect.para: Default property sort function sorts properties by their labels (case-insensitively).
GetSortFunction, wxPropertyGridInterface::Sort, wxPropertyGridInterface::SortChildren

briefdescription.para: Sets x coordinate of the splitter.

simplesect.para: Splitter position cannot exceed grid size, and therefore setting it during form creation may fail as initial grid size is often smaller than desired splitter position, especially when sizers are being used.

briefdescription.para: Moves splitter as left as possible, while still allowing all labels to be shown in full.

parameterdescription.para: If false, will still allow private children to be cropped.

briefdescription.para: Sets appearance of value cells representing an unspecified property value.

detaileddescription.para: Default appearance is blank.

simplesect.para: If you set the unspecified value to have any textual representation, then that will override "InlineHelp" attribute.
wxPGProperty::SetValueToUnspecified(), wxPGProperty::IsValueUnspecified()

briefdescription.para: Sets vertical spacing.

detaileddescription.para: Can be 1, 2, or 3 - a value relative to font height. Value of 2 should be default on most platforms.

briefdescription.para: This static function enables or disables automatic use of wxGetTranslation() for following strings: wxEnumProperty list labels, wxFlagsProperty child property labels.

detaileddescription.para: Default is false.

briefdescription.para: Forwards to DoRegisterEditorClass with empty name.
Registers a new editor class.

simplesect.para: Returns pointer to the editor class instance that should be used.

briefdescription.para: wxPropertyGrid is a specialized grid for editing properties - in other words name = value pairs.

detaileddescription.para: List of ready-to-use property classes include strings, numbers, flag sets, fonts, colours and many others. It is possible, for example, to categorize properties, set up a complete tree-hierarchy, add more than two columns, and set arbitrary per-property attributes.
Please note that most member functions are inherited and as such not documented on this page. This means you will probably also want to read wxPropertyGridInterface class reference.
See also wxPropertyGrid Overview.

sect1.title: Event Handling
sect1.para: To process input from a property grid control, use these event handler macros to direct input to member functions that take a wxPropertyGridEvent argument.

The following event handler macros redirect the events to member function handlers 'func' with prototypes like: voidhandlerFuncName(wxPropertyGridEvent&event)Event macros for events emitted by this class:
EVT_PG_SELECTED (id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_SELECTED event, generated when a property selection has been changed, either by user action or by indirect program function. For instance, collapsing a parent property programmatically causes any selected child property to become unselected, and may therefore cause this event to be generated.
EVT_PG_CHANGED(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_CHANGED event, generated when property value has been changed by the user.
EVT_PG_CHANGING(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_CHANGING event, generated when property value is about to be changed by user. Use wxPropertyGridEvent::GetValue() to take a peek at the pending value, and wxPropertyGridEvent::Veto() to prevent change from taking place, if necessary.
EVT_PG_HIGHLIGHTED(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_HIGHLIGHTED event, which occurs when mouse moves over a property. Event's property is NULL if hovered area does not belong to any property.
EVT_PG_RIGHT_CLICK(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_RIGHT_CLICK event, which occurs when property is clicked on with right mouse button.
EVT_PG_DOUBLE_CLICK(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_DOUBLE_CLICK event, which occurs when property is double-clicked on with left mouse button.
EVT_PG_ITEM_COLLAPSED(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_ITEM_COLLAPSED event, generated when user collapses a property or category.
EVT_PG_ITEM_EXPANDED(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_ITEM_EXPANDED event, generated when user expands a property or category.
EVT_PG_LABEL_EDIT_BEGIN(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_LABEL_EDIT_BEGIN event, generated when user is about to begin editing a property label. You can veto this event to prevent the action.
EVT_PG_LABEL_EDIT_ENDING(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_LABEL_EDIT_ENDING event, generated when user is about to end editing of a property label. You can veto this event to prevent the action.
EVT_PG_COL_BEGIN_DRAG(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_COL_BEGIN_DRAG event, generated when user starts resizing a column - can be vetoed.
EVT_PG_COL_DRAGGING, (id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_COL_DRAGGING, event, generated when a column resize by user is in progress. This event is also generated when user double-clicks the splitter in order to recenter it.
EVT_PG_COL_END_DRAG(id, func): Respond to wxEVT_PG_COL_END_DRAG event, generated after column resize by user has finished.
Use Freeze() and Thaw() respectively to disable and enable drawing. This will also delay sorting etc. miscellaneous calculations to the last possible moment.

Category:wxPropertyGrid
Appearance:
wxMSW appearancewxGTK appearancewxMac appearance
